sentences.en: And reluctant acquiescence by some parties would only have led to turmoil.
sentences.cn: 勉强接受了,也会造成混乱局面.

sentences.en: Being silent can be a mode of resistance, respect, apathy or acquiescence.
sentences.cn: 沉默可以是一反制, 可以是尊重, 可以是冷漠或默许.

sentences.en: Chinese acquiescence could inspire a similar approach to electric vehicles.
sentences.cn: 中国的默认可能促使美方对中国电动汽车采取类似行动.

sentences.en: Darcy shook his head in acquiescence.
He did it under the acquiescence of his boss.
sentences.cn: 他是在上司的默许下做这件事的.

sentences.en: Her parents will never take acquiescence of such a marriage.
sentences.cn: 他的父母决不会答应这门婚事.

sentences.en: However a bias towards acquiescence in the status quo also has costs.
sentences.cn: 然而,安于现状也是有代价的.

sentences.en: Ken nodded in acquiescence, and walked out of the office followed by the rest the team.
sentences.cn: 肯恩在默许中点头, 而且走出被小组的其它部分跟随的办公室.
克劳福特先生点头表示同意.

sentences.en: Some will seek'status'through renewed acquiescence and Uncle Tomism ( Alvin F. Poussaint )
sentences.cn: 有人用逆来顺受主义来寻求‘立足之地’ ( 阿尔文F. 普森特 )

sentences.en: The chief inclined his head in sign of acquiescence.
These verbs all mean to frighten into submission, compliance, or acquiescence.
sentences.cn: 这些动词都表示通过吓唬使人屈服 、 顺从或默认.

sentences.en: This is due to his acquiescence.
Why have the Chinese shifted from strident opposition to muted acquiescence?
sentences.cn: 为什么中国突然转变了态度,变得沉默或者说使默许了 呢 ?

words.tran_cn: 默认的；默许的；甘心接受的

trans.tran_en: Acquiescence is agreement to do what someone wants, or acceptance of what they do even though you do not agree with it
